headings: Business Administration with Specialization in Healthcare Management MBA
Prepare for leadership roles in the competitive healthcare industry.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
MBA with Specialization in Healthcare Management
What Can You Do With an MBA in Healthcare Management Degree?
Why Earn My MBA in Healthcare Management at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Our 100% online healthcare management MBA program offers a broad perspective and combines best management practices with highly focused healthcare principles, concepts and systems. You will develop the knowledge and skills you need to advance to the executive, administrative or management level in public or private healthcare organizations.

Our program is structured so that you can complete your degree in as little as 14 months. It has also been ranked among the best, fastest and most affordable in the U.S. by multiple higher education resource guides.
The Norris-Vincent College of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

Our professional faculty bring real-world experience to the classroom and stay up to date on the latest practices in business and healthcare management. They are also dedicated to providing the best possible online learning experience.
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.

The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that employment opportunities for medical and health services managers are expected to increase significantly through 2031, adding thousands of new openings.

Earning your MBA degree in healthcare management will give you the credentials you need to immediately advance your career in healthcare administration, hospital and clinic business operations, clinical and practice management, patient access management and other related fields.

Upon completing the 10 courses to earn your MBA in healthcare management degree, you can also count the credits for six of those courses toward our regular MBA degree or our M.S. in Business Data Science and Analytics degree. That means you only have to take four additional courses to earn a second master’s degree.

If you are interested in adding an internship opportunity to your MBA in healthcare management degree plan, we have a dedicated internship advisor who is available to help set you up with the best possible internship situation that aligns with your educational and career goals. You can also gain additional practical experience by competing in our annual BizPitch student entrepreneurship contest.

Over the last several years, our online MBA program has earned top national rankings for quality and affordability from respected publications like Fortune Magazine, as well as multiple online higher education guides, including Online MBA Coach and BestValueSchools.org. Also, our accreditation by AACSB International is a credential that is held by less than 6% of the world’s schools that offer business degree programs.

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

“I have no doubt, had I not gone through the Angelo State business school myself, that I would be anywhere near where I am today. It’s an honor to own a San Angelo-based business and give back to the university who helped me grow into an entrepreneur. Knowing I can directly influence the next generation of business-owners is an incredible feeling.”

Blake Vincent, Class of 1996
